abstract.p: Ken Macdonald wins Met Life/Met Golf Association Ike Tournament (S)

block.p: Ken Macdonald of Upper Montclair, a recent graduate of the University of Richmond, repeated as champion of the Met Life/Met Golf Association Ike Tournament yesterday at the Nassau Country Club in Glen Cove, N.Y.

The 22-year-old Macdonald shot par 69 in each of the final two rounds for a 54-hole total of 208 to win by one stroke over Marc Turnesa of Rockville Centre Links, who yielded the lead with a double-bogey on the 16th hole.

Ken Macdonald of Upper Montclair, a recent graduate of the University of Richmond, repeated as champion of the Met Life/Met Golf Association Ike Tournament yesterday at the Nassau Country Club in Glen Cove, N.Y.

The 22-year-old Macdonald shot par 69 in each of the final two rounds for a 54-hole total of 208 to win by one stroke over Marc Turnesa of Rockville Centre Links, who yielded the lead with a double-bogey on the 16th hole.
Macdonald, who plans to turn pro after the U.S. Amateur this summer, missed only eight greens and made four birdies over the three rounds on the 6,509-yard course.
In the team competition, Andrew Svoboda and Jim Graham of Winged Foot totaled 435 to win by one stroke over David Macdonald, cousin of the two-time champion, and Christopher Blum of Plandome.
